column4: i get this error "Error: unable to load nvidia kernel driver! Be sure to have installed
the nvidia driver for your running kernel.
when i do sudo nvidia-glx-config enable", following this tutorial https://help.ubuntu.com/6.10/ubuntu/desktopguide/C/graphics-cards.html , can anyone help?
sorry forgot to remove the new lines :<
what version of ubuntu are you using?
do you have the linux restricted modules for your kernel?
as far as i know yes (in Synaptic pm i have "Non-free Linux 2.6.17 modules on x86_64 generic" installed
I think the command is  just  'nvidia xconfig' now
I think the command is  just  'nvidia-xconfig' now
got it all working now, thanks :)
np, may want to file a bug on those docs if there isn't one already
you can set owner of the whole partition in fstab if you wish

yes, you can set owner, group, and permissions umask
